Post.title: Centos7 ethX
Post._content: Centos7enp0s3ethX ethX + vim /etc/default/grub GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 ``` GRUB_TIMEOUT=5 GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR=$(sed s, release .*$,,g /etc/system-release) GRUB_DEFAULT=saved GRUB_DISABLE_SUBMENU=true GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT=console GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/usrlv rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/swaplv crashkernel=auto vconsole.keymap=us rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/rootlv vconsole.font=latarcyrheb-sun16 rhgb quiet net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY=true ``` + grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg + mv /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-enp0s3 /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0 + reboot
Post.raw: --- title: Centos7 ethX date: 2017-10-10 17:57:57 tags: --- Centos7enp0s3ethX ethX + vim /etc/default/grub GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 ``` GRUB_TIMEOUT=5 GRUB_DISTRIBUTOR=$(sed s, release .*$,,g /etc/system-release) GRUB_DEFAULT=saved GRUB_DISABLE_SUBMENU=true GRUB_TERMINAL_OUTPUT=console GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX=rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/usrlv rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/swaplv crashkernel=auto vconsole.keymap=us rd.lvm.lv=rootvg/rootlv vconsole.font=latarcyrheb-sun16 rhgb quiet net.ifnames=0 biosdevname=0 GRUB_DISABLE_RECOVERY=true ``` + grub2-mkconfig -o /boot/grub2/grub.cfg + mv /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-enp0s3 /etc/sysconfig/network-scripts/ifcfg-eth0 + reboot

Post.title: ceph-ansible
Post._content:
ceph-ansibleceph



- 
- 
- selinux

ansible

    pip install ansible==2.3.1.0
    
    mkdir /etc/ansible
    
    touch /etc/ansible/hosts

ceph-ansible

    git clone https://github.com/ceph/ceph-ansible.git
    
    cd ceph-ansible
    
    git checkout -b stable-3.0 origin/stable-3.0





ceph0monmgrosd/etc/ansible/hosts

    [mons]
    ceph0
    
    [osds]
    ceph0
    
    [mgrs]
    ceph0
    

ceph-ansible

    cd ceph-ansible/group_vars
    cp all.yml.sample all.yml
    cp mons.yml.sample mons.yml
    cp mgrs.yml.sample mgrs.yml
    cp osds.yml.sample osds.yml
    

all.yml

    dummy:
    ceph_origin: repository
    ceph_repository: community
    ceph_mirror: http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph
    ceph_stable_key: http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph/keys/release.asc
    ceph_stable_release: luminous
    ceph_stable_redhat_distro: el7
    monitor_interface: ens160
    monitor_address: 0.0.0.0
    public_network: 123.59.153.0/24
    cluster_network: 10.10.20.0/24
    osd_objectstore: bluestore
    handler_health_osd_check: false

all.yml.sample

monitor_interface, public_network  cluster_network 

osd_objectstorebluestorefilestore

ceph03sdb,sdc,sdddOSD

osds.yml 

    ---
    dummy:
    devices:
      - /dev/sdb
      - /dev/sdc
      - /dev/sdd
    osd_scenario: collocated

osds.yml.sampleosd

100M

100Mceph block, ceph block.db, ceph block.wal,  ceph data

ceph

    cd ceph-ansible
    cp site.yml.sample site.yml
    
    ansible-playbook site.yml 
    

crush rule

crush rulehostcephserverpool

crush ruleosd

    ceph osd getcrushmap -o crushmap
    
    crushtool -d crushmap -o crushmap.txt
    

crushmap.txt hostosd

    rule replicated_rule {
            id 0
            type replicated
            min_size 1
            max_size 10
            step take default
            step chooseleaf firstn 0 type osd
            step emit
    }
    

crushmap

    crushtool -c crushmap.txt -o crushmap
    ceph osd setcrushmap -i crushmap
    

POOL

POOL

    ceph osd pool create testpool 32
    

ceph

    cd ceph-ansible
    
    cp infrastructure-playbooks/purge-cluster.yml .
    
    ansible-playbook purge-cluster.yml

Post._content:
ceph-ansiblecephceph-ansible

ceph-deployceph

# 

4

| Hostname | OS | Public network | Cluster network | Role |
| ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- | ----- |
| ceph001 | CentOS Linux release 7.5.1804 (Core) | 172.16.143.151 | 172.16.140.151| ceph-deply |
| ceph002 | CentOS Linux release 7.5.1804 (Core) | 172.16.143.152 | 172.16.140.152| mon osd mgr rgw mds |
| ceph003 | CentOS Linux release 7.5.1804 (Core) | 172.16.143.153 | 172.16.140.153| mon osd mgr rgw mds |
| ceph004 | CentOS Linux release 7.5.1804 (Core) | 172.16.143.154 | 172.16.140.154| mon osd mgr rgw mds |

# 
* SELinux
* ceph001ceph002~4
* ceph

cephceph**luminous**

```
[ceph_stable]
baseurl = http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph/rpm-luminous/el7/$basearch
gpgcheck = 1
gpgkey = http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph/keys/release.asc
name = Ceph Stable repo

[ceph_noarch]
name=Ceph noarch packages
baseurl=http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph/rpm-luminous/el7/noarch/
gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=http://mirrors.ustc.edu.cn/ceph/keys/release.asc
```

# 

## 
ceph001ceph-deployceph

```
yum install ceph-deploy -y
ceph-deploy install --release luminous ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
ceph-deploy new --cluster-network 172.16.140.0/24 --public-network 172.16.143.0/24 ceph002 ceph003 ceph004

```

ceph.conf ceph.mon.keying

ceph.conf

```
[global]
fsid = 9ef68d6d-5117-4064-8969-39f51e91557e
public_network = 172.16.143.0/24
cluster_network = 172.16.140.0/24
mon_initial_members = ceph002, ceph003, ceph004
mon_host = 172.16.143.152,172.16.143.153,172.16.143.154
auth_cluster_required = cephx
auth_service_required = cephx
auth_client_required = cephx
```


## MON

```
ceph-deploy mon create ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

## key

```
ceph-deploy gatherkeys ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

## OSD

```
ceph-deploy osd create ceph002 --data /dev/sdb
ceph-deploy osd create ceph003 --data /dev/sdb
ceph-deploy osd create ceph004 --data /dev/sdb
```

## MGR

```
ceph-deploy mgr create ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

## ceph

```
ceph-deploy admin ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

## RGW

```
ceph-deploy rgw create ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

## MDS

```
ceph-deploy mds create ceph002 ceph003 ceph004
```

```
ceph osd pool create cephfs_metadata 8 8
ceph osd pool create cephfs_data 8 8
ceph fs new cephfs_demo cephfs_metadata cephfs_data
```

Post.title: Git patch
Post._content:
git format-patchgitpatchdiff git am

## patch

master checkout masterpatch

```bash
$ git format-patch -M master   # -Mpatch
$ git am 001-xxx.patch         # commit
```

## commitpatch

```bash
$ git format-patch 1bbe3c8c19 # 1bbe3c8c19commit,1bbe3c8c19

git format-patch -n 1bbe3c8c19 # 1bbe3c8c19ncommit1bbe3c8c19

$ git format-patch HEAD^      # 1commitpatch
$ git format-patch HEAD^^     # 2commitpatch
$ git format-patch HEAD^^^    # 3commitpatch

$ git format-patch -1         # HEAD^  
$ git format-patch -2         # HEAD^^
$ git format-patch -3         # HEAD^^^

$ git format-patch -1 -4      # -1-4commit-1-4

$ git format-patch <ref1>..<ref2>  ## commitref1ref2 
```

## patch

commitpatchcommit

```bash
$ git format-path 1bbe3c8c19 --stdout > xxx.patch
```

## patch

```bash
# patch
$ git apply --stat xxx.patch

#
$ git apply --check xxx.patch

# patch
$ git am -s < xxx.patch
```

```bash
$ git format-patch HEAD^^     # 2commitpatch

$ git format-patch -3         # HEAD^^^

$ git format-patch -1 -4      # -1-4commit-1-4

$ git format-patch <ref1>..<ref2>  ## commitref1ref2 
```

## patch

commitpatchcommit

```bash

```

```bash
#

$ git am -s < xxx.patch
```

```
[kube@kube ~]$ systemctl start docker
[kube@kube ~]$ systemctl enable docker

[kube@kube ~]$ docker --version
Docker version 1.13.1, build 07f3374/1.13.1

```


Swap

```
swapoff -a

```

# k8s

kubernetes  

```
cat <<EOF > /etc/yum.repos.d/kubernetes.repo
[kubernetes]
name=Kubernetes
baseurl=https://mirrors.aliyun.com/kubernetes/yum/repos/kubernetes-el7-x86_64
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
repo_gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://mirrors.aliyun.com/kubernetes/yum/doc/yum-key.gpg https://mirrors.aliyun.com/kubernetes/yum/doc/rpm-package-key.gpg
exclude=kube*
EOF

```

selinux  

```
setenforce 0
sed -i 's/^SELINUX=enforcing$/SELINUX=permissive/' /etc/selinux/config
```
kubeadm, kubeletkubectl

```
yum install -y kubelet kubeadm kubectl --disableexcludes=kubernetes

systemctl enable kubelet && systemctl start kubelet
```

centosiptables  

```
cat <<EOF >  /etc/sysctl.d/k8s.conf
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-ip6tables = 1
net.bridge.bridge-nf-call-iptables = 1
EOF

sysctl --system
```

PLEASE READ EACH STEP CAREFULLY! In order to log into MariaDB to secure it, we'll need the current password for the root user. If you've just installed MariaDB, and you haven't set the root password yet, the password will be blank, so you should just press enter here. Enter current password for root (enter for none): OK, successfully used password, moving on... Setting the root password ensures that nobody can log into the MariaDB root user without the proper authorisation. You already have a root password set, so you can safely answer 'n'. Change the root password? [Y/n] Y New password: Re-enter new password: Password updated successfully! Reloading privilege tables.. ... Success! By default, a MariaDB installation has an anonymous user, allowing anyone to log into MariaDB without having to have a user account created for them. This is intended only for testing, and to make the installation go a bit smoother. You should remove them before moving into a production environment. Remove anonymous users? [Y/n] Y ... Success! Normally, root should only be allowed to connect from 'localhost'. This ensures that someone cannot guess at the root password from the network. Disallow root login remotely? [Y/n] Y ... Success! By default, MariaDB comes with a database named 'test' that anyone can access. This is also intended only for testing, and should be removed before moving into a production environment. Remove test database and access to it? [Y/n] Y - Dropping test database... ... Success! - Removing privileges on test database... ... Success! Reloading the privilege tables will ensure that all changes made so far will take effect immediately. Reload privilege tables now? [Y/n] Y ... Success! Cleaning up... All done! If you've completed all of the above steps, your MariaDB installation should now be secure. Thanks for using MariaDB! ``` ### master /etc/my.cnf[mysqld] ```vim server-id=1 log-bin = /var/lib/mysql/mysql-bin binlog-ignore-db=mysql binlog-ignore-db=information_schema binlog-ignore-db=performance_schema ``` db ```bash systemctl restart mariadb ``` ```bash mysql -u root -p GRANT REPLICATION SLAVE ON *.* TO 'replic_user'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'password'; FLUSH PRIVILEGES; SHOW MASTER STATUS; QUIT; ``` master dumpslave ```bash mysql -u root -p mysql> FLUSH TABLES WITH READ LOCK; mysql> SHOW MASTER STATUS; ``` ```bash mysqldump -u root -p --databases [database-1] [database-2] ... > /root/db_dump.sql mysql -u root -p mysql> UNLOCK TABLES; ``` ### slave masterdump ```bash scp root@172.16.143.171:/root/db_dump.sql /root/db_dump.sql mysql -u root -p < /root/db_dump.sql ``` /etc/my.cnf[mysqld] ```vim server-id=2 og-bin = /var/lib/mysql/mysql-bin binlog-ignore-db=mysql binlog-ignore-db=information_schema binlog-ignore-db=performance_schema ``` db ```bash systemctl restart mariadb ``` ```bash mysql -u root -p mysql> CHANGE MASTER TO MASTER_HOST='172.16.143.171',MASTER_USER='replic_user', MASTER_PASSWORD='password', MASTER_LOG_FILE='mysql-bin.000001', MASTER_LOG_POS=107; ``` MASTER_LOG_FILE MASTER_LOG_POS master```show master status``` ```bash START SLAVE; SHOW SLAVE STATUS\G ``` ## masterdbslave ## host1 --> host2 host2 --> host1 host1/ect/my.cnf ```bash auto-increment-increment = 2 auto-increment-offset = 1 ``` host2/ect/my.cnf ```bash auto-increment-increment = 2 auto-increment-offset = 2 ```

Post.title: pacemakermysql
Post._content:
blog[mysql-replication](https://yanyixing.github.io/2018/03/02/mysql-replication/)mysql(mariadb)mysql(mariadb)

pacemakermysql(mariadb)VIPmysql(mariadb)

## 

OS: CentOS Linux release 7.3.1611 (Core)

DB: mysql  Ver 15.1 Distrib 5.5.56-MariaDB, for Linux (x86_64) using readline 5.1

host1(master): 172.16.143.171

host2(slave): 172.16.143.172


## 


```bash
yum install -y mariadb-server
```

blog


```bash
systemctl stop mariadb

systemctl disable mariadb
```

pacemaker

```bash
yum install pcs pacemaker corosync fence-angets-all resource-angets -y

systemctl start pcsd

systemctl enable pcsd

systemctl start pacemaker

systemctl enable pacemaker

systemctl start corosync

systemctl enable corosync

passwd hacluster

pcs cluster auth ceph01 ceph02

pcs cluster setup --start --name cluster_mysql ceph01 ceph02

pcs cluster start --all

pcs property set stonith-enabled=false

pcs property set no-quorum-policy=ignore
```

## 

```bash
pcs resource create virtual_ip ocf:heartbeat:IPaddr2 \
ip=172.16.143.200 cidr_netmask=24 nic=eth0 op monitor interval=30s on-fail=restart

pcs resource create mysql ocf:heartbeat:mysql  \
binary="/usr/bin/mysqld_safe"   config="/etc/my.cnf" \
  datadir="/var/lib/mysql"   pid="/var/lib/mysql/mysql.pid" \
  socket="/var/lib/mysql/mysql.sock"  \
 additional_parameters="--bind-address=0.0.0.0"   op start timeout=60s \
  op stop timeout=60s   op monitor interval=20s timeout=30s \
on-fail=standby

pcs resource clone mysql clone-max=2 clone-node-max=1
```

## 

```bash
[root@ceph01 ~]# pcs status
```

```
rule rgw_ec_rule {
```

Post.title: timedatectl
Post._content:
CentOS 7 

CentOS 6datehwclockCentOS 7timedatectl



1.1 GMTUTCCSTDST 

(1) UTC

(UTC, Universal Time Coordinated)

(2) GMT

 (Greenwich Mean Time)(UTCGMT)

(3) CST

 (China Standard Time)

1
GMT + 8 = UTC + 8 = CST
(4) DST

(Daylight Saving Time) 

1.2 

(1) 

RTC(Real-Time Clock)CMOS

(2) 

RTC

timedatectl 

2.1 

```
timedatectl // timedatectl status
```
2.2 

```
timedatectl set-time "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS"
```

2.3 

```
timedatectl list-timezones
```

2.4 

```
timedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai
```

2.5 NTP

```
timedatectl set-ntp yes //yesno
```

2.6 

```
timedatectl set-local-rtc 1
hwclock --systohc --localtime //
```
 UTC

2.6  UTC

```
timedatectl set-local-rtc 1
hwclock --systohc --utc //
```

NTP

```
yum install ntp //ntp
systemctl enable ntpd //
systemctl start ntpd //
timedatectl set-timezone Asia/Shanghai //
timedatectl set-ntp yes //ntp
ntpq -p //
```
,  /etc/ntp.conf  server .

```
   watch kubectl get po --namespace tidb  -l app.kubernetes.io/component=tidb-initializer
4. Get the TiDB password
   PASSWORD=$(kubectl get secret -n tidb demo-tidb -o jsonpath="{.data.password}" | base64 --decode | awk '{print $6}')

   kubectl port-forward -n tidb svc/demo-tidb 4000:4000 &
   mysql -h 127.0.0.1 -P 4000 -u root -D test -p
6. View monitor dashboard for TiDB cluster
   kubectl port-forward -n tidb svc/demo-grafana 3000:3000
```
